page.title: 17TOURISM: FILKINS/EASTLEACH
page.content: Work by the village ornamental black- smith can be seen in the Bridal Barn and at the Forge. The tiny Museum in the main street houses a collection of local bygones. It was started in the thirties by George Swinford, now 97, with support from Sir Stafford Cripps; in 1983 it was formally set up as the Swinford Museum in the ancient cottage given by Sir John Cripps. Adjoining is the village lock-up, used overnight by the drunk and disorderly before their appearance at Burford Magistrates' Court. The Victorian Church and the listed Council Houses attract special- ist visitors. The small area of EASTLEACH in the bl- ock includes main tourist attractions of the village - the Clapper Bridge, the banks of the R Leach, bright with daffodils in the spring, and the two fine medieval churches and tithe barn.
